Start a garden: Grow your own fruits, vegetables, and herbs to provide yourself with fresh, healthy produce. You can also grow medicinal plants like lavender, chamomile, and peppermint for natural remedies.
Learn basic first aid: Knowing how to treat common injuries and illnesses can be lifesaving. Learn basic first aid techniques such as wound care, CPR, and how to use an EpiPen.
Find alternative sources of nutrition: If you can't get to a grocery store, look for alternative sources of food such as foraging for wild edible plants or hunting for game.
Build a community: Find other people in your area who are also struggling to maintain their health and form a community. Pool your knowledge and resources to help each other stay healthy.

Create a self-care routine: Take care of your mental and emotional health by practicing mindfulness, meditation, and other relaxation techniques. Make sure to get enough sleep, exercise regularly, and your time with loved ones.
